info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 28 at 8:19AM MST by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A SNOW SQUALL WILL AFFECT PARTS OF FLAT TOPS...LOWER YAMPA RIVER BASIN...ELKHEAD AND PARK MOUNTAINS...AND CENTRAL YAMPA RIVER BASIN COUNTIES... HAZARDS...A snow squall accompanied by winds of up to 30 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than one mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 818 AM MST, a snow squall was along a line extending from 28 miles west of Craig to 19 miles northwest of Meeker and moving east at 25 MPH. THIS SQUALL WILL BE NEAR... Craig around 915 AM MST. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 40 in Colorado between mile markers 50 and 100. Colorado 13 between mile markers 59 and 116. Colorado 318 between mile markers 53 and 60. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this squall. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
